The search results show extensive information about Lord of the Rings fan conventions, cosplay, and fandom communities in 2024. Here's what I found:

## Lord of the Rings Convention Presence in 2024

Lord of the Rings has a strong presence at Dragon Con, which is now in its 37th year and "has always leaned heavily into its Tolkienian roots, with Middle-earth inspired programming, cosplay, partying, and a global Fellowship serving to inspire many of the 70,000 or so fans who converge on downtown Atlanta every year. And the 2024 version will be no different!"

### Major Conventions Featuring LOTR in 2024

**Dragon Con 2024**
- Featured appearances by Billy Boyd, Elijah Wood, and Dominic Monaghan as special guests
- Hosted "An Evening at Bree," a long-time tradition at DragonCon as part of the High Fantasy Track
- The Evening at Bree event included "live bands, dancing, a costume contest showcasing jaw-dropping cosplay talent, and a mini-concert from Bree's own Elf Choir"

**San Diego Comic-Con 2024**
- Featured exclusives from Prime Video's The Rings of Power, New Line Cinema's The War of the Rohirrim, and TheOneRing.net fan community
- Included a Hall H panel for The Rings of Power with cast, showrunners, and a new extended trailer
- Featured exclusive merchandise including commemorative "You Haven't Aged A Day" shirts and "Gollum/Smeagol 2024" election shirts

### Cosplay and Fan Culture

Dragon Con 2024 featured "incredible cosplay to be seen all around the con, from all kinds of fandoms" with particularly creative mashup cosplay including "The Eye of Sauron in shutter shades"(no content)Awesome Con specifically welcomed LOTR fans with "panels, celebrity meet & greets, and a cosplay meetup" featuring activities like trivia, group photos, and dance parties

### Ongoing Fan Community Activities

Conventions provide fans opportunities to "participate in Q&A with the actors, take pictures with them, get autographs" and engage in "many activities during the event: quizz, lottery, karaoke... while meeting new people" and "chat with one another about a same center of interest"

The search results demonstrate that LOTR fandom remains vibrant at major conventions like Dragon Con, San Diego Comic-Con, and other events throughout 2024, with extensive cosplay participation, dedicated programming tracks, and strong community engagement across multiple platforms.
